caption:
This photograph captures a passionate and intense moment of a male musician playing the drums. He is wearing a vibrant red shirt and a matching red headscarf. The musician has a full beard and his facial expression exudes deep concentration and emotional intensity, possibly during a live performance. Sweat is visible on his face, highlighting the physical exertion involved in his performance.

The background behind the musician is completely dark, focusing all attention on him. His eyes are half-closed, and his mouth is slightly open, which along with his facial expressions suggests he is deeply connected to the music he is creating. His left hand is blurred in motion, indicating a dynamic drumming action.

Overall, the photograph conveys a powerful sense of music, motion, and emotion, capturing a moment that seems both personal and expansive, typical of a live music performance.
title: Black bongo player performs at the International Amphitheater in Chicago as part of the annual PUSH 'Black Expo' in the fall of 1973. The annual event showcases Black talent, educational opportunities, stars, art and products to provide Blacks with an awareness of their heritage and capabilities, and help them towards a better life.
